The Mueller investigation has been nothing more than a colossal waste of time & money. 

Nevertheless, the American people deserve to see the results in its entirety.
Make no mistake, this investigation has yet to find any evidence of collusion w Russia or wrongdoing on the part of the President @realDonaldTrump, which was the intent & purpose in the first place.

While this investigation has drawn on for far too long & has wasted millions of taxpayer dollars, I believe that our taxpayers have the right to see what the government has been doing with their money instead of hearing bits & pieces of leaked information from political elites

Today, I joined my colleagues @Jim_Jordan @RepMarkMeadows @DevinNunes & many others in support of H.Con.Res. 24 - Expressing the sense of Congress that the report of Special Counsel Mueller should be made available to the public & to Congress.

The President is thinking ahead, rebuilding our fiscal health on a foundation of security instead of focusing on a quick fix. 

We can’t put this off for the next generation.
With this budget proposal, we begin the process of undoing decades of irresponsible spending in DC. It won't happen overnight, and we shouldn’t expect it to.
.@realDonaldTrump's budget plan provides for long-term, structural change to the way our government has operated for decades & will maintain the economic growth we've seen the last 2 years.

It's refreshing to see an administration that operates with business principles. 

When the government gets out of the way, it gives room for businesses to prosper, stimulating their local economies & creating new jobs. As a result, federal revenues increase.
The federal government has no money of their own - only the taxpayers' money. It's on Congress to be good stewards of that money.
